fields.description: This task should go through the SimplePush specification and make sure that we have not missed anything, or if there have been updates they should be followed and our own docs updated to reflect this.
fields.summary: Go through the SimplePush spec and make sure we are following it.

comments.body:
I've found the following items where we don't follow the [specification|https://wiki.mozilla.org/WebAPI/SimplePush/Protocol]
* Notifications for missing channelIDs should return 200 and not 404 like we do now.
* We should support the Ping message
* We should use http/wss for both protocol and endpoints.
* We are allowed to clean up channels upon receiving a hello message. Any channels that are not included in this message can be removed.

Things to verify:
* The hello message should be able to send an empty uaid, or a missing one
* The hello message should be able to handle an empty channelIDs array. 
* Go through and add extend our test with the tests from https://github.com/jrconlin/simplepush_test
Gone through and created tasks for this issues I've found.

This was handled in the SockJS test by discarding empty responses for the websocket tests in question:
{code}
private Object readOutboundDiscardEmpty(final EmbeddedChannel ch) {
    final Object obj = ch.readOutbound();
    if (obj instanceof ByteBuf) {
        final ByteBuf buf = (ByteBuf) obj;
        if (buf.capacity() == 0) {
            ReferenceCountUtil.release(buf);
            return ch.readOutbound();
        }
    }
    return obj;
}
{code}

fields.description:
The Netty subsystem current looks something like this:
{noformat}
<subsystem xmlns="urn:org.jboss.aerogear.netty:1.0">
    <netty>
        <server name="simplepush" socket-binding="simplepush" factoryClass="org.jboss.aerogear.simplepush.netty.SimplePushBootstrapFactory"/>
    </netty>
</subsystem>
{noformat}
The additional netty element is not needed and should be removed.

fields.description:
wondering if it would be useful if the server was setup to do paging of the results. 

this is really just for the admin UI,
fields.summary: Paging Support for admin UI

comments.body: +1 - This should be a given when dealing with potentially long lists of data
+1 I've tried to open the variant page having installed ~3000 mobile instances and it stuck showing a message: "The page has become unresponsive. Do you want to close it?" (Android 4.2.2)

I started on this.
Just to be clear : we do only paging on the UI side for now ? Nothing to be done the UPS side ? 
I'm following this approach http://stackoverflow.com/a/13033425 and looks good so far. I'm using a mixin to avoid too much duplication.

How many items do we want per page ? 10 ? 

[~hbons] Any advice about the layout for the pagination ("next", "previous" and page numbers links) ? I will start with a classic / lean design
It would be nice, and savce work, if we could use this pattern: https://www.patternfly.org/widgets/#pagination
[~hbons] Could you elaborate a bit on patternfly ? Is it a concrete CSS lib or just guidelines ? Samples seems to be based on bootstrap.

I really think this should start on the server side,  why wait for all that data to be brought over, it's just going to slow down the UI if it is all done on the client especially if there are Huge lists

fields.description:
I have run into an issue trying to integrate the latest java-sender 0.1.0 release with the quickstart-backend. 

After modifying the 'defaultJavaSender.sendTo' in the sendLeads method to use the extra'masterSecret' param and changing the import to use the 'org.jboss.aerogear' namespace, the war compiled and installed successfully.

I then created some Leads and then pushed the 'Send Lead' button but in the console I got the following exception:

{noformat}
19:04:14,755 ERROR [org.jboss.aerogear.controller.log] (http--0.0.0.0-8080-1) AG_CONTROLLER000005: Exception Message: 'loader constraint violation: when resolving method 
"org.jboss.resteasy.client.core.executors.ApacheHttpClient4Executor.<init>(Lorg/apache/http/client/HttpClient;Lorg/apache/http/protocol/HttpContext;)V" the class loader (instance of org/jboss/modules/ModuleClassLoader) of the current class, org/jboss/aerogear/unifiedpush/resteasy/RestEasyClient, and the class loader (instance of org/jboss/modules/ModuleClassLoader) for resolved class, 
org/jboss/resteasy/client/core/executors/ApacheHttpClient4Executor, have different Class objects for the type org/apache/http/client/HttpClient used in the signature': java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraint violation: when resolving method 
"org.jboss.resteasy.client.core.executors.ApacheHttpClient4Executor.<init>(Lorg/apache/http/client/HttpClient;Lorg/apache/http/protocol/HttpContext;)V" the class loader (instance of org/jboss/modules/ModuleClassLoader) of the current class, org/jboss/aerogear/unifiedpush/resteasy/RestEasyClient, and the class loader (instance of org/jboss/modules/ModuleClassLoader) for resolved class, 
org/jboss/resteasy/client/core/executors/ApacheHttpClient4Executor, have different Class objects for the type org/apache/http/client/HttpClient used in the signature
	at org.jboss.aerogear.unifiedpush.resteasy.RestEasyClient.submitPayload(RestEasyClient.java:85) [java-sender-0.1.0.jar:0.1.0]
{noformat}

After a quick search some people suggested of duplicate libs, checked the WEB-INF folder and found some duplicate jars provided by the server already (e.g. jax-rs) mainly because of the transitive deps of the java-sender
https://gist.github.com/cvasilak/d2b7a60e93bf7bf31b1d

so I exclude them from the pom file and redeploy. But then I got another exception of a missing class 
{noformat}
org.apache.http.auth.Credentials
{noformat}

Not sure where the problem lies..

You can find the changes on my 'java.sender' branch here:

https://github.com/cvasilak/aerogear-push-quickstart-backend/tree/java.sender

Thanks
fields.summary: Exception trying to integrate java-sender 0.1.0 with quickstart-backend

fields.description:
The our SimplePush Server implementation can be embedded into the JBoss Application server, by basically installing a Netty-Subsystem into the "modules" folder of the JBoss Application Server. Besides the installation, a little bit of configuration on the standalone.xml file is required as well.

Dan has writte up some nice documentation about the entire process:
https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-simple-push-server/tree/master/wildfly-module

We need to see how this "installation" and "configuration" would work for "AeroGear UnifiedPush" on OpenShift. E.g. in a cartridge or something like that.


Goal: Our SimplePush Server is running _inside_ of the AS, on OpenShift.
fields.summary: SimplePush on OpenShift

comments.body:
Inside of the configuration we need a separate port, on which we receive SockJS/WebSocket messages (and send stuff out).

See details for configuration, for the custom port:
https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-simple-push-server/tree/master/wildfly-module#add-a-socket-binding

To get the SimplePush Server running inside of the AS on Openshift, we'll need to create a modified standalone.xml file that contains the following:

1) the org.jboss.aerogear.netty extension
2) a socket binding that will be used by the Netty server
3) a thread factory that will be passed to the Netty server
4) the Netty subsystem

We'll also need to add two modules (org.jboss.aerogear.simplepush and org.jboss.aerogear.netty) to the AS modules directory. (The following file contains an example of adding a module to the existing AS cartridge: https://github.com/openshift/origin-server/blob/master/cartridges/openshift-origin-cartridge-jbossas/openshift-origin-cartridge-jbossas.spec#L74)

Hi Farah, 

we have gotten some feedback from the WildFly team and will most probably do this differently with regards to the Netty subsystem. I'll post to the mailing list about this as soon as I get a chance.
I've created an [OpenShift forum thread|https://www.openshift.com/forums/openshift/websocket-support-for-as7-application] based off this [gist|https://gist.github.com/danbev/5bfb139a873871cc64ce].

The WebSocket issue has been [fixed|https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=984748] and we can now embedded Netty and get the SimplePush server working with WebSockets.
The server itself should listening to the following port:
{noformat}
    <socket-binding name="simplepush" port="8676"/>
{noformat}

A client would connect using port 8000, for example:
{noformat}
    http://wsfix-dbevenius.rhcloud.com:8000/simplepush/info
{noformat}

With this the websocket upgrade request:
{noformat}
    GET /simplepush/510/syd1_3ao/websocket HTTP/1.1
    Connection: Upgrade
    Upgrade: websocket
    Sec-WebSocket-Version: 13
    Sec-WebSocket-Key: MTMtMTM3NDM5OTIwNjU4OQ==
    Cookie: __utma=152814842.1660699493.1368787904.1368787904.1368787904.1; __utmz=152814842.1368787904.1.1.utmcsr=(direct)|utmccn=(direct)|utmcmd=(none)
    Host: 127.6.129.129:8676
    Content-Length: 0
{noformat}
succeeds with the response of:
{noformat}
    HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols
    Connection: Upgrade
    Sec-WebSocket-Accept: ksne8lJvjsuTZXGPaXCNvQJHPg8=
    Upgrade: websocket
{noformat}

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=984748

comments.body: for collection data (on iOS) something like https://github.com/mattt/Antenna might be handy

When I think mobile analytics I think of both: Error Logs & Mobile App Analytics

IRT to Mobile App Analytics... I'm using Count.ly (https://github.com/Countly/countly-server) for one of our apps, and I really like it. Its clean, and easy to implement. Perhaps some sort of partnership could be established to utilize or integrate Count.ly into AeroGear?

i'm not sure that plan for this feature, but as we've been building our mobile just a few thoughts on what types of metrics/analytics that could potentially be gathered:

Users
    Date
    New
    Returning
    Total

Sessions
    Date
    New
    Returning
    Total   

Location
    Country
        ex. US, Canada, Germany, etc...
    City
        ex. Raleigh, Toronto, Munich, etc...

Devices
    OS
        ex. Android, iOS, etc...
    OS Details (Major Version & Minor Version)
        ex. iOS 7.0.2, iOS 7.1, Android 4.4, etc...
    Device Maker/Brand
        ex. iPhone 5 (Global), iPhone 5S (GSM), iPod Touch 5G, SAMSUNG-SGH-I727, HTC One, Full MIPS Android on Emulator, Simulator, etc...
    Resolution/Width & Height
            ex. 800x480, 1920x1080, etc...

App Version
    ex. 1.0, 3.1, 2.1.223, etc...

Carrier
    ex. AT&T, T-Mobile, Verizon, etc...

Custom Events (Can be used to track a wide variety of custom events that could be used by a funnel, or could be used to drill down into data. Its just a simple server based counter.)
    ex. Newsletter Signups, Subscriptions, Bought, Video Plays, Articles Read, Button Clicks, Demographics, Behavior flow/how users user the app, etc...
    
Error/Bug Reporting    
    Automatically sends crash report (no sensitive or user data) back to AG
    Gives user option to give additional error information and perhaps a screenshot
    
    
    
Potentially useful links/examples
    https://github.com/Countly/countly-server
    http://docs.phonegap.com/en/3.3.0/cordova_device_device.md.html#Device
    https://github.com/AppBlade/AppBladeSDK/wiki/Feature-Implementation-Guide#iOS-crash-reporting
    http://devcenter.kinvey.com/phonegap/guides/troubleshooting
    http://try.crashlytics.com/reports/
    https://www.google.com/analytics/mobile/
    http://piwik.org/blog/2012/04/how-to-use-piwik-to-track-mobile-apps-activity-clicks-phones-errors-etc/

A lot of the suggested data we do not really care about.

Please see the related mailing list thread, for the real discussion. Let's not use JIRA a mailing-list / forum replacement

This will be removed, once we ship with the AdminUI.

A possible idea is to implement a registration prompt/dialog, on the AdminUI:
* On first launch we present the dialog and ask for username:password

So i was trying to implement this and it looks like the "enroll" endpoint is secured, so currently you must be logged in to create a user.

So either we change that, which could be a security hole,   or we try creating a user with a script that a user has to run
Having a script to create the initial user is a good solution from a security perspective - that is what AS 7/EAP 6 does (add-user.sh)

For the august timeframe lets just go with a default admin user, and force a password change.  Luke will be able to get that in in the specified timeframe.

We'll look into scripts, or other options for the future.
here is the PR for the password change stuff https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unified-push-server/pull/53
This has been merged in,  so i'm going to close this, and create a new JIRA, about creating scripts

fields.description:
Sender endpoint on the unified-push-server are protected by Basic Auth but the server needs to challenge the client,

gist of the error (using resteasy impl) : 
https://gist.github.com/anonymous/5849463
fields.summary: Add Basic Auth Challenge for sender endpoints

comments.body:
I tried Christos' test case for the challenge, on my "WWW-Authenticate" branch, using this "unit test":
https://gist.github.com/cvasilak/3f64c3c806b0af11fef6 


Works perfect and I am noticing the expected flow:
* The server receives REQ, returns 401
* our iOS client library is reacting on the challenge and sends the request with the proper credentials.
* Push Server accepts "proper" request, and delivers Push Notification to the cloud (here APNs)
* got a Push Message to my device with this.

fields.description: Currently, the directory that's used in the connection URL for the PushEE datasource is hardcoded to ~/pushee. This is problematic when the home directory is not writable (e.g., on OpenShift). The storage directory should be made configurable.
fields.summary: Make the PushEE datasource storage directory configurable

comments.body:
* The OpenShift folks could treat the "AeroGear UnifiedPush Cartridge" (in terms of a database) similar to something like Drupal (which just needs a database), this would "ensure" a database is present, when the JBoss Application Server boots.

* AeroGear UnifiedPush "binds" to a JNDI name (PushEEDS) for the Database.

* OpenShift has a MySQL cartridge, which defines the "MysqlDS" JNDI name:
https://github.com/openshift/origin-server/blob/master/cartridges/openshift-origin-cartridge-jbossas/versions/7/standalone/configuration/standalone.xml#L103
If the UnifiedPush would just bind to the _MysqlDS_ JNDI name (e.g. on an openshift branch), we would be good already...

a TEMPORARY test:
https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unified-push-server/tree/openshift_kborchers

and some little gist:
https://gist.github.com/matzew/ea11d1a9532f2d75745a

As discussed with Dan, I've changed the name of the MySQL datasource that's currently configured in the cartridge standalone.xml file from "MysqlDS" to "PushEEDS" (to match the name from the UnifiedPush Server's persistence.xml file), as shown here:

https://github.com/fjuma/openshift-origin-cartridge-aerogear-push/blob/master/versions/0.8.0/standalone/configuration/standalone.xml#L107

This change allows us to use ag-push.war on OpenShift without modifying its persistence.xml file. The only modification required right now is to remove the h2-ds.xml from ag-push.war. (I currently do this before adding the ag-push.war file to the cartridge repo.) 

I've also added in a new datasource for SimplePush.

Hi [~fjuma], 

I have created a branch, which could be used for this:
https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unified-push-server/tree/OpenShiftCartridge

IT does no longer contain the XML file in question:
https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unified-push-server/tree/OpenShiftCartridge/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF

I agree this should be configurable, but I'm not sure yet if it should be in present in the UI.

OpenShift should change the default path without bothering the user with it.
$HOME should normally be writable.

If it's not for whatever reason we can ask to change it and show a field in the UI or point to a configuration file.

What are potential use cases for changing the default path?

PushEEDS is used on 'OpenShift', as stated in AGPUSH-275 we should offer CLI so that users can add their own DB, using the same JNDI name;

that's good enough

fields.description:
The SimplePushSender makes use of com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClient, which creates a number of daemon threads to perform its duties. 

The problem with our usage of this is that we are creating an instance of the AsyncHttpClient in our constructor. There is no clean up the threads create and for every call more threads will build up over time. Another issue with this is that the container may create multiple instance of the class as it sees fit. 

A solution to this issue would be to put the creation of the AsyncHttpClient instance in a method annotated with @PostConstruct which will only be called once, and then also close the AsyncHttpClient in a method annotated with @PreDestroy
fields.summary: SimplePushSender should create/close AsyncHttpClient in @PostConstruct/@PreDestroy

Initially we are supporting the following Push Networks:
* APNs for iOS
* GCM for Android
* SimplePush for Web-based clients

The current server will be renamed server-core and the Netty impl. will be named server-netty.

fields.description: User Story to capture the work required for getting a first release out
fields.summary: First Unified Push Server release

comments.body:
Features 
* Users can register PushApplications (HTTP/Admin UI)
* Users can register MobileVariants (HTTP / Admin UI)
* Devices can register themself with a MobileVariant
* Sending messages to the different devices

For our first release, early August, we need to implement the following _EPICS_.

Each of the epics has more sub-tasks to be more detailed on the actual implementation work.

Epics:
* Specifications: AGPUSH-63
* Client SDKs: AGPUSH-70
* Admin UI: AGPUSH-66
* PushNetwork Integration: AGPUSH-60
* RESTful Endpoints: AGPUSH-57
* Documentation and Guides: AGPUSH-61
* Examples: AGPUSH-71

fields.description:
On "uninstall" (or disabling push), the DEVICE sends a note to the network, that it's token is no longer "valid" for App XYZ.

Our Unified Push Server needs a service to query the APNs to collect the inactive tokens.

components.name: UnifiedPush-java-sender
components.description: Java API for accessing the UnifiedPush through java

fields.description:
The Unified Push Server has a HTTP interface which accepts "Push Notification Messages" to be delivered to various Push Networks.

In order to make things easier for developers, that want to submit "Push Notification Messages" from their backend app, we should add a convenience JAva library, that submits messages and internally does the HTTP related work

Ideally the java client is build on an async http lib:

https://github.com/AsyncHttpClient/async-http-client

fields.description:
Selective Send HTTP/REST endpoint:

This endpoint accepts a message/payload, and a list of "identifiers" (alias) and/or deviceType

The message is submitted to be received by those "Mobile Variant Instances" of a "Push Application", that are matching this "identifiers"


For details on the terminology, see the definitions in the PR for AEROGEAR-1171
fields.summary: Push: REST Endpoints: Sender API: selective send

comments.body:
The [PushEE|https://github.com/matzew/pushee] PoC contains an early version of a "selective" endpoint.

A seleceted number of channels (SimplePush) can receive a push message

Needs to filter by:
* alias
* deviceType
* Category
Needs to be supported in java sender too
Let's add support for variantID 'querying' as well...
PR for category: https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unified-push-server/pull/35/files
PR for variantIDs: https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unified-push-server/pull/38

fields.description:
Once the push application has been registered  by the admin user (ie a push notification app id have been generated), Admin UI enable the feature of sending push notification.

- either to all mobile variant instances,
- or to a selected group of mobile variant instances (query to retrive all mobile variants associated with this push app)
fields.summary: UI Admin: Compose a Push Message and send it

comments.body: How about we show the CURL command for sending, on the Admin UI ?

A first PR fro this has been submitted. A live version can ben seen here newpush-sblanc.rhcloud.com (admin /123 )
Discussion on the ML :
http://lists.jboss.org/pipermail/aerogear-dev/2014-February/006366.html
http://lists.jboss.org/pipermail/aerogear-dev/2014-February/006423.html

items.fromString:
Once the push application has been registered  by the admin user (ie a push notification app id have been generated), Admin UI enable the feature of sending push notification.

- either to all mobile variants,
- or to a selected group of mobile variants (query to retrive all mobile variants associated with this push app)
items.toString:

- either to all mobile variant instances,

fields.description:
The REST endpoints receive HTTP requests in order to perform a few different "use cases:
* PushMessage Send-Request to deliver messages to the particular networks (GCM, APNs, simplePush)

Currently the HTTP endpoints are (somewhat) directly performing the storage of the information. Helpers/Services classes are performing the work, but this is all "blocking IO".


Ideally, the HTTP endpoints are just receiving the HTTP requests, quickly publish a Message to a "Message Broker" and immediately return (if possible).

The actual work (of storing, via JPA etc) should be then done in a Consumer of a Topic/Queue of the Message broker;



Attached are two _simple_ diagrams, to show the idea...

* Registration of new Push Application (-> some update/delete is supported too)

* Registration of new Mobile Variant Instance (eg iOS/Android app, running on the phone)...
* PushMessage Send-Request to deliver messages to the particular networks (GCM, APNs, simplePush)

Ideally, the HTTP endpoints are just receiving the HTTP requests, quickly publish a Message to a "Message Broker" and immediately return (if possible).

The actual work (of storing, via JPA etc) should be then done in a Consumer of a Topic/Queue of the Message broker;



Attached are two _simple_ diagrams, to show the idea...

fields.summary: verify application/variation/device model with the IDM

comments.body:
Looking at the Agent, I see that the "model" (somewhat) requires a login-name;

See https://github.com/picketlink/picketlink/blob/master/idm/api/src/main/java/org/picketlink/idm/model/Agent.java#L43-45


Regarding the model in the [gist|https://gist.github.com/matzew/6012edf62d1915689a67] at least for the concept of
* abstract application (PushApplication)
* abstract mobile variation (MobileApp)

Do _NOT_ have a "login name"

I think, even an actual _installation_ of an app, on a phone (MobileApplicationInstance in the [gist|https://gist.github.com/matzew/6012edf62d1915689a67]) has not really the notion of a "login name"

The installation would store more something like below:
* Device Token 
* Device Type
* Device Operating system
* Version (of the OS)

HOWEVER, some applications could also store the username (login name), but not all applications really demand this, to push out bits!

Using pure JPA, instead of the IDM in PushEE

https://github.com/matzew/pushee
After evaluation, the PushEE project moves on, using straight forward JPA entities

Specifically, identified by the token (also in the JSON payload), JS needs to be able to update the category.

It looks like there is no way to "GET"  a list/one instance other than getting a particular variant and then looking at the instance array.

was thinking this could/should go in the corresponding VariantEndpoint.java file

ex:  /application/{pushAppId}/{variantType}/{variantId}/instance(s)

and  /application/{pushAppId}/{variantType}/{variantId}/instance/{instanceId}


should we reopen?
actually this would probably make more sense to put it in the MobileVariantinstanceEndpoint class.

fields.summary: Add Components to this Project

comments.body:
those look pretty good.

do we need a Push Cordova plugin thing?

I've been thinking about this for a while now and I'm honestly not sure. The question is, does Cordova, or one of its plugins bridge JS to the notifications? On the one hand, since it's a native app, it could be covered by the iOS or Android clients but the user would have to know how to incorporate their own or build that bridge. Since it's also using JS, it could just be handled by the JS SimplePush client but then you're only getting in app notifications while it's open. I say we at least create a Cordova component and we'll investigate this more later.

My point is, currently no own Cordova Plugin is needed.


This one works fine for Android/iOS:
https://github.com/phonegap-build/PushPlugin

@Kris:
* bridges "native push" (GCM/APNs) to JS
* Going with Cordova, I'd not do the "native" push my self
* Not sure I'd use SimplePush here, currently

+1 on a Cordova "component"

One more thought on Cordova:

The JS client SDK (e.g. for "token registration") could be used on the JS callback that receive the "token" from the native code.
So, that part would be used in both worlds:
* SimplePush clients registering channel IDs
* Cordova apps registering their native tokens

I think we need a component for the "Java Sender API" (AEROGEAR-1206):
* Unified Push Client - Java Sender

I think, for interaction with the "network provider", I want these:

* Unified Push Server GCM
* Unified Push Server APNs
* Unified Push Server SimplePush
* Unified Push Server PushNetwork (a more generic one?)

Do we need need to duplicate "Unified Push Server" and "SimplePush" so many times?

I would recommend

# Unified Push
# SimplePush
# Security
# APNs
# Server
# Client
# Admin
# UI

etc....

Then mix and match as needed - such as "SimplePush, Server, Security".  Otherwise you'll end up with tag spagetti imo.

I think that is the point ... these are components and not tags so should not be used as such. Tags would be nice to have but I don't think that is what these are meant for. We use them as tags on AEROGEAR but I feel like that is wrong. Maybe it's just me.
you has powers to fix this

Specific Components

The following are very specific to a certain part of the "work":

* UnifiedPush-server
* UnifiedPush-ios
* UnifiedPush-android
* UnifiedPush-javascript
* UnifiedPush-admin
* UnifiedPush-java(-sender)
* UnifiedPush-apns
* UnifiedPush-gcm
* UnifiedPush-simplePush (=== connection TO (various) SP networks)
* SimplePush-server
* SimplePush-javascript (=== client, I think there is only a JS client)


Now, various of the above "component" have similar concerns, like security or documentation.

Generic components (e.g. used like a tag)

* security
* Documentation
* Examples
* PushNetwork (e.g. when investigating for adding new supported ones...)
* OpenShift (support for UP / SP)
* Tooling (== Tooling / RAD )

Perhaps these are really more tags, but I am fine in "abusing" these components as tags.

fields.description:
A UserAgent's channelIds are stored on the server even if the connection has been dropped. A UserAgent can upon reconnecting specify a UserAgentId(uaid) and zero or more channels which indicate that this is an existing UserAgent.
 
On the server side we should introduce a policy for how long these channels and the uaid are valid. This should be configurable, but a default for the server should be discussed. Perhaps as a day, a week?
